links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
formula: a(n) = (1/25)*{-32*(n mod 5)+3*[(n+1) mod 5]+8*[(n+2) mod 5]+13*[(n+3) mod 5]+48*[(n+4) mod 5]}-5*[C(2*n,n) mod 2], with n>=0. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jul 23 2009a(0) = 5; a(n) = 8 - 8*ceiling(n/5) + 8*floor(n/5) + ceiling((n-2)/5) - floor((n-2)/5) + ceiling((n-3)/5) - floor((n-3)/5). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2014
prog: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 18000); x=contfrac(sqrt(29)); for (n=0, 20000, write("b010128.txt", n, " ", x[n+1])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A010484 (Decimal expansion). - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
